conclusion: Let me analyze how the shadows labeled A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves downward. I'll examine both the position and size changes for each shadow.

Each object casts a shadow (labeled A, B, C, and D).
Currently, the light source appears to be positioned from above.
When a light source moves closer to objects: 1. Shadows become larger 2. Shadows move outward from the objects 3. Shadow edges become less defined (more blurry).
Shadow A (from the beige hand/glove model): Current position: Cast slightly to the left of the object.
Shadow A (from the beige hand/glove model): Current size: Relatively small.

premise: When light moves downward, Shadow A's size will increase as the light gets closer.
conclusion: Shadow A will extend further outward from the object.

conclusion: Shadow A will become more distinct and sharp-edged.

premise: When light moves downward, Shadow B's size will increase significantly.
conclusion: Shadow B will extend further to the right.

conclusion: Shadow C will extend further outward from its object.
